summary: This bill, the Youth Poisoning Protection Act, aims to ban the sale of consumer products containing a high concentration (10% or more by weight) of sodium nitrite to individuals. It amends the Consumer Product Safety Act, classifying such products as banned hazardous products. It includes exceptions for commercial/industrial uses and products regulated as drugs, devices, cosmetics, or food (including certain meat and poultry products). The bill would take effect 90 days after enactment.
